TEXT.TITLE: WALLENBERG GROUP RAISES STAKE IN ERICSSON
TEXT.BODY: Sweden's Wallenberg group said it raised its holding in telecommunications maker Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson <eric.St.> to 37.5 of the voting rights from 28.9 pct. The move by the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Foundation, one of the institutions at the core of the group of companies formed by the late industrialist Marcus Wallenberg, further consolidated group control over one of its key firms, analysts said. The foundation now controls 14.1 pct of Ericsson's voting rights with 22.3 pct held by the group's investment companies <AB Investor> and <Forvaltnings AB Providentia>. The move comes after the Wallenberg group fought off a hostile takeover bid earlier this month for match and packaging conglomerate Swedish Match AB <smbs.St> from arms and chemical concern Nobel Industrier AB <NOBL.ST> by increasing its stake in Swedish Match to 85 pct from 33 pct. REUTER
